poem:
**The Young Musician**

In the hush of Wales' embrace,  
a piano's voice, articulate with youth,  
speaks from the fingertips of Wang.  
Time bends at his command,  
notes weave their own world.  
Here, orchestras bow, landscapes unfurl,  
and the future holds its breath,  
in a melody birthed from silence,  
conquering the echoes of mere applause.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "BBC Young Musician competition crowns pianist Ryan Wang The 2024 BBC Young Musician competition has been won tonight by 17-year-old pianist, Ryan Wang. Three musicians competed in the final, in which each played a concerto with the BBC National Orchestra of Wales conducted by Ben Gernon before an audience at Bristol Beacon. Joining Wang was another pianist, Jacky Zhang (also a category finalist in 2022’s competition), and violinist Shlomi Shahaf. Shahaf performed Tchaikovsky’s Violin Concerto;". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
